meanings.definition: A source or origin of a stream or river.
meanings.sent1: The fount of the river was a small spring in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The fount of the stream was a melting snowbank.
meanings.sent3: The fount of the river decided to take a detour through the meadow.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a fount, bubbling up from deep within.
meanings.sent5: The fount of the stream glistened in the sunlight, inviting all to drink.

meanings.definition: A source of a desirable quality or commodity.
meanings.sent1: The local bakery was known as the fount of delicious pastries.
meanings.sent2: Her wisdom was a fount of inspiration for all who knew her.
meanings.sent3: The fount of chocolate in the shop seemed to call out to me.
meanings.sent4: His generosity was a fount that never seemed to run dry.
meanings.sent5: The fount of creativity within her mind produced beautiful artwork.

meanings.definition: A reservoir or supply of something.
meanings.sent1: The library was a fount of knowledge for the students.
meanings.sent2: Her garden was a fount of colorful flowers in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The fount of snacks in the pantry mysteriously disappeared overnight.
meanings.sent4: His heart was a fount of love, overflowing with affection for his family.
meanings.sent5: The old well served as a fount of water for the entire village.
